Key Match Events: The Cubs extended their win streak to five games, matching their season high for a third time.
The Cubs won their fifth straight series with a 5-3 win over the Nationals.
The Cubs' offense delivered a four-run fifth inning to secure the win.
Nationals starter DJ Herz held the Cubs to no hits going into the fifth inning.
Cubs' center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong brought in the first run with a sac fly.
A fielding error by Nationals center fielder Jacob Young allowed the Cubs to tie the game.
Dansby Swanson doubled down the left-field line to add a fourth run in the fifth inning.
Nico Hoerner scored on a throwing error in the seventh inning to secure the victory.
Pete Crow-Armstrong made a crucial defensive play in the sixth inning to keep José Tena off the basepaths.
Christian Bethancourt threw out CJ Abrams attempting to steal second base in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Nico Hoerner expressed pride in the team's resiliency and their ability to win close games.
Javier Assad mentioned the confidence the team has in their offense.
Manager Craig Counsell highlighted the importance of the team's performance in August and their goal to play meaningful games in September.
